member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.Testing.PlaceMonitorSimulator
member.summary: Represents a monitor that identifies and maintains a list of geographic places visited by the device.
member.remarks: This entity monitors several primitive sensor values, such as the device's geographic location, to identify a geographic location visited frequently. The most frequented places are then classified using various heuristics into a kind of a place. The classification is best effort and should not be expected to yield full accuracy in all styles of device usage. An application can and should implement a mapping from this pre-defined classification of places into concepts and visuals releavant in the application context.

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.Testing.TrackPointMonitorSimulator
member.summary: Represents a monitor that identifies and maintains a list of geographic places visited by the device.
member.remarks: This entity monitors several primitive sensor values, such as the device's geographic location, to identify a geographic location visited frequently. The most frequented places are then classified using various heuristics into a kind of a place. The classification is best effort and should not be expected to yield full accuracy in all styles of device usage. An application can and should implement a mapping from this pre-defined classification of places into concepts and visuals releavant in the application context.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.StepCounterRecorder.InitializeDataPollTimer
member.summary: Initializes data poll timer, aligning the timer interval with system clock. Will stop and deallocate any previous instance. Note! Not thread safe!
member.remarks: In order for the timer interval to be aligned with the system clock, you'll need to start the timer immediately.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.ActivityMonitorSimulator.GetActivityHistoryAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns time ordered list of activities occured during given time period.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. The returned list includes all activity monitor readings within the given time pediod. If available, the result list begins with the last entry before the beginning of the given period. This enables an application to determine the activity state of the device at the start of the period before the first actual activity event within that period.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.ActivityMonitorSimulator.GetCurrentReadingAsync
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.remarks: The return value may be null in case reading cannot be obtained.

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.Testing.ActivityMonitorSimulator.Enabled
member.summary: Enables or disables activity change event monitoring.
member.remarks: events occur only while the property is set to true. However, sensor's current value can be queried via even when the property is false.

member.name: E:Lumia.Sense.Testing.ActivityMonitorSimulator.ReadingChanged
member.remarks: An application may register a handler for this event to be notified of activity changes as an alternative to actively polling the values using .

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.Testing.ActivityMonitorSimulator
member.summary: Represents an activity state monitor sensor.
member.remarks: This sensor returns the user's activity state values derived from various sources of sensor and contextual information within the device.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.StepCounterSimulator.GetStepCountHistoryAsync(Windows.Foundation.DateTime,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Returns time ordered list of step counts during given time period. Data granularity is usually around five minutes.
member.remarks: The available data extends only up to the last 10 days. The returned list includes step counts within the given time pediod. If available, the result list begins with the last entry before the beginning of the given period. This enables an application to determine the step count at the start of the period before the first actual event within that period.

member.name: T:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecorder
member.summary:
Utility for recording sensor data
You can use to record data from a sensor for storage or playing back at a later date.

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.LoadFromText(System.String,Windows.Storage.Streams.UnicodeEncoding)
member.remarks: If you have saved the recording using the content viewer launched by , the content will be using UTF-16 LE encoding.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.example:
The following example loads sensor recording from given text (using UTF-8 encoding)
SenseRecording recording = await SenseRecording.LoadFromText( recordingData, UnicodeEncoding::Utf8 );

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.LoadFromText(System.String)
member.remarks: This method expects the content to be saved using UTF-16 LE encoding. If you have saved the recording using the content viewer launched by , the content will be using UTF-16 LE encoding.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.example:
The following example loads sensor recording from given text
SenseRecording recording = await SenseRecording.LoadFromText( recordingData );

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.LoadFromFileAsync(System.String,Windows.Storage.Streams.UnicodeEncoding)
member.summary: Loads from a file in application's installation directory
member.remarks: If you have saved the recording using the content viewer launched by , the content will be using UTF-16 LE encoding.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.example:
The following example loads sensor recording from application's installation directory (using UTF-16 LE encoding)
SenseRecording recording = await SenseRecording.LoadFromFileAsync( "json.txt", UnicodeEncoding::Utf16LE );

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.LoadFromFileAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Loads from a file in application's installation directory.
member.remarks: This method expects the content to be saved using UTF-16 LE encoding. If you have saved the recording using the content viewer launched by , the content will be using UTF-16 LE encoding.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:
member.example:
The following example loads sensor recording from application's installation directory
SenseRecording recording = await SenseRecording.LoadFromFileAsync( "json.txt" );

member.name: M:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.SaveAsync
member.summary: Prompts user to save the recording in Json format in Documents folder
member.remarks: If you save the recording using the viewer launched by this method, the content will be saved using UTF-16 LE encoding. Place make note of that when loading the recording using LoadFromFileAsync.
member.exception: All errors are thrown as instances of . To get details about the error pass the property of the exception to . This method can return the following enumeration values:

member.name: P:Lumia.Sense.Testing.SenseRecording.Description
member.summary: Description of the recording. Initially empty, can be modified by the developer to describe the recording before saving.
